Anyone see any news about this today? I think its comforting to know that at least some politicians (i.e. this guy Blunt) care about their constuents. Here is a press clipping I found:
 
 
House Majority Whip Roy Blunt (Mo.) and House Democratic Whip Steny Hoyer (Md.) today introduced legislation authorizing several programs for Special Olympics, including the design and implementation of Special Olympics education programs, the expansion of international participation, and the improvement and implementation of the Special Olympics Healthy Athletes program.
 
 
 Thoughts?
we spend alot of money on non-disabled athletes, and since it's illegal to discriminate due to a disability, I would find it hypocrtical to fund one and not the other.

Just a little follow up, Bush signed Blunt's bill today.

 I agree, it is horrible how we treat the disabled now-a-days. I think that the government should create an organization that not only helps with the Special Olympics, but creates jobs for people like that, so that they don't just sit at home and watch TV all day, like a friend of mine does who has cereberal palsey (sp?)
